vocabulary.definition: observable occurrences or facts that are perceived through the senses
vocabulary.example: The aurora borealis is a natural phenomena that can be seen in the night sky.

vocabulary.definition: exhibiting a weak repulsion by both poles of a magnet
vocabulary.example: The diamagnetic properties of water cause it to slightly repel when in the presence of a magnetic field.

vocabulary.definition: a measure of an object's resistance to changes in its rotation
vocabulary.example: The figure skater adjusted her body position to decrease her moment of inertia during a spin.

vocabulary.definition: a small alteration or disturbance in a system
vocabulary.example: The scientist observed the perturbation in the experimental results caused by the change in temperature.

vocabulary.definition: the production of an electric or magnetic effect by the movement of one object near another
vocabulary.example: The movement of the magnet induced an electric current in the wire coil.

vocabulary.definition: the transfer of heat through a fluid (liquid or gas) by the movement of the fluid itself
vocabulary.example: The boiling water exhibited convection as the hot water rose to the top and the cooler water sank to the bottom.
